page.title: 17PLAYING FIELD
page.content: {King George's Field}was officially {opened on the 14th July 1951. The land 6.23 acres of Glebe Land, was{bought from the Ecclesiastical Commissioners {in 1948 for Â£580.}This was{money {raised by a Fund Sub-committee, {subscriptions from villagers}and a grant from the King George's Field Foundation. The layout was agreed to provide cricket, football, hockey, netball and school organised games areas, children's corner, tennis courts, bowling green, car park and pavilion. Not all these facilities have been provided yet. The school used the organised games area until the old school building was vacated in 1980.
